title: Quiz 2: Hormones & Menstrual Cycle
description: Understanding the hormonal regulation and phases of the female reproductive cycle.

questions.question: Which hormone is primarily responsible for the rupture of the Graafian follicle (Ovulation)?
questions.explanation: The surge of Luteinizing Hormone (LH) triggers the rupture of the mature follicle and release of the ovum.
questions.hint: This hormone is produced for only about 14 days and causes the 'luteal' transformation.

questions.question: The hypothalamus produces ___BLANK___, which acts on the anterior pituitary gland to secrete FSH and LH.
questions.explanation: GnRH (Gonadotrophin-Releasing Hormone) is the master regulator released by the hypothalamus.

questions.question: Match the menstrual phase with its primary characteristic:

pairs.right: Release of the ovum from the ovary

questions.hint: Proliferative means 'to grow', Secretory means 'to secrete/prepare'.

questions.question: Which of the following are physiological effects of Oestrogen? (Select all that apply)

richContent.content: Hormone Profile: Oestrogen is proliferative and develops secondary characteristics.

options.text: Stimulates growth of secondary sex characteristics

questions.explanation: Oestrogen grows the lining, develops characteristics, and inhibits milk. Progesterone is the primary 'pregnancy maintainer'.

questions.question: Progesterone only acts on tissues that have previously been acted upon by oestrogens.
questions.explanation: This is true; oestrogen 'primes' the tissues (e.g., endometrium) for progesterone to have its secretory effect.
questions.hint: Can you decorate a house before it is built?

questions.question: If fertilisation does not occur, the corpus luteum degenerates approximately how many days after ovulation?
questions.explanation: The corpus luteum degenerates about 10 days after ovulation if no HCG signals a pregnancy, leading to menstruation.
questions.hint: It is less than two weeks.

questions.question: During the Secretory/Luteal phase, which hormone is dominant in preparing the uterus for implantation?
questions.explanation: Progesterone (produced by the corpus luteum) makes the endometrium vascular and spongy for the fertilized ovum.

questions.question: Arrange the events of the ovarian cycle in chronological order:

items.text: LH surge causes rupture of follicle (Ovulation)
Corpus Luteum forms and secretes Progesterone

questions.explanation: FSH -> Growth -> Estrogen -> LH Surge -> Ovulation -> Corpus Luteum -> Progesterone.

questions.question: Which hormone is responsible for water and electrolyte retention in the body?
questions.explanation: Oestrogen assists in water and electrolyte retention.

questions.question: In a 28-day cycle, ovulation typically occurs on day ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Ovulation occurs roughly 14 days before the next period, which is day 14 in a 28-day cycle.
